items.title: Nikita Bier Joins X as Head of Product
items.summary:
- *Nikita Bier*, known for creating teen-focused apps like Gas and TBH, has been appointed Head of Product at Elon Musk's X, formerly Twitter.
- Bier plans to leverage the power of *Grok* to create hyper-relevant timelines and enhance user experience on the platform.
- His expertise in driving rapid growth and engaging youth demographics aims to help X expand beyond traditional text-based social network users.

items.title: Remark raises $16M to build human-powered expert models for e-commerce
items.summary:
- Remark uses thousands of human experts to chat with online shoppers and train AI models, leading to a *10% net revenue gain* for partners.  
- The startup raised $16 million in Series A funding to expand its expert network and improve AI training, shifting to a *SaaS-based* revenue model.  
- By combining expert human advice with AI personas, Remark aims to boost *online store conversion rates* from about 1.5% closer to physical store rates of 30-35%.

items.title: Threads launches its own DM inbox, as app moves further away from Instagram
Trump’s prospective TikTok buyer reportedly includes Oracle, Blackstone, a16z
Grammarly acquires AI email client Superhuman
Ford EV sales fall 31% while hybrids rise
Meta adds business voice calling to WhatsApp, explores AI-powered product reccomendations
David George from a16z on the future of going public at TechCrunch Disrupt 2025
Mo Jomaa breaks down IPO prep for founders on the Scale Stage at TechCrunch All Stage
US Senate removes controversial ‘AI moratorium’ from budget bill
Genesis AI launches with $105M seed funding from Eclipse, Khosla to build AI models for robots
xAI raises $10B in debt and equity
Cloudflare launches a marketplace that lets websites charge AI bots for scraping
ChatGPT: Everything you need to know about the AI-powered chatbot
items.summary: - *ChatGPT*, launched in November 2022 by OpenAI, now has over *300 million weekly users* and has evolved significantly with features like voice and text-to-video (Sora) models. - In 2025, OpenAI is expanding globally with hardware improvements (using Google's AI chips), new AI coding agent *Codex*, and expanding infrastructure via programs like OpenAI for Countries. - Challenges include *internal leadership exits*, lawsuits, and *concerns over AI effects* on critical thinking; recent updates aim to improve AI personality and prevent issues like sycophancy and inappropriate content for minors.

items.title: Sri Mandir keeps investors hooked as digital devotion grows
items.summary:
- *Sri Mandir*, an Indian Hindu devotional app by AppsForBharat, raised $20 million led by Susquehanna Asia Venture Capital, reflecting strong investor interest in digitizing religious services.  
- The app has over 40 million downloads, 3.5 million monthly active users, and 1.2 million devotees performed online prayers in 70+ temples, with 20% of revenue from the Indian diaspora abroad.  
- With plans to expand physical hubs, enhance AI features for faith questions, and grow temple partnerships, AppsForBharat aims for profitability by 2027-28 and an eventual IPO.

items.title: Clio Acquires Legal Data Giant vLex for $1B
items.author: Marina Temkin
items.summary:
- Clio, a Canadian legal software company, acquired vLex, a prominent legal data platform, for $1 billion in cash and stock, enhancing its AI capabilities.  
- vLex's extensive legal document database is a strategic asset, enabling Clio to merge software for legal practice and business, benefiting small to medium law firms with AI-driven tools.  
- Following this deal and a recent funding round, Clio now reports $300 million in annual recurring revenue and competes with major players like Thomson Reuters and LexisNexis.

items.title: Tesla sends driverless Model Y from factory to customer to promote its robotaxi tech
Levelpath secures $55M to disrupt procurement
items.summary:
*Levelpath, founded by the creators of Scout RFP, raised $55M in Series B funding to expand its AI-powered procurement platform.*
- The company aims to **disrupt legacy vendors** like Coupa and Ariba by offering a **more user-friendly**, AI-enhanced solution.
- *Procurement represents the second-largest company expense*, making innovative software like Levelpath crucial for significant savings and efficiency.*

items.title: Fintech Bolt progresses its turnaround by landing Klarna as a partner
Instagram Adds Spotify Song Previews to Stories
items.summary:
- Instagram now allows users to listen to *previews of Spotify songs* shared directly in Stories, enhancing music discovery on the platform.  
- This follows a similar update enabling song streaming in Instagram Notes, positioning Instagram as a more competitive music discovery hub alongside TikTok.  
- Additionally, Instagram introduced new fonts for Stories and Reels, including a *limited-time font inspired by Rosalía’s handwriting* with special unlockable symbols.

items.title: At TechCrunch All Stage: VC red flags, founder signals, and pre-seed traps — Charles Hudson will tell you what investors really see
Apple Considers Using OpenAI and Anthropic AI Models for Siri
items.summary:
- Apple is reportedly considering letting OpenAI and Anthropic power its updated Siri instead of relying solely on its in-house AI models.
- The company faced delays in launching AI-enabled Siri due to technical challenges, pushing the timeline from 2025 to 2026 or later.
- This move reflects Apple's attempt to catch up in the AI space, as it has trailed behind competitors like Google and OpenAI for several years.

items.title: Best iPad apps for unleashing and exploring your creativity
Netflix teams up with NASA to boost its live TV offering
Songscription launches an AI-powered ‘Shazam for sheet music’
items.summary:
*Songscription* introduced an AI tool that quickly transcribes audio into sheet music, useful for both professionals and hobbyists. 
- The platform can transcribe for various instruments, with a focus on piano, and plans to include band arrangements and guitar tabs. 
- This tool simplifies music creation, especially for those unfamiliar with reading sheet music, while raising questions about the legal aspects of AI-powered transcription.

items.title: From $5 to financial empowerment: Brandon Krieg at TechCrunch
items.summary: *Brandon Krieg*, co-CEO of *Stash*, built a movement to democratize investing, helping millions start with as little as $5.* At TechCrunch All Stage, he’ll reveal insights on launching innovative tools like the AI Money Coach and StashWorks.* The event offers founders valuable lessons on scaling while maintaining mission-driven core values.

items.title: US government takes down major North Korean ‘remote IT workers’ operation
Tailor, a ‘headless’ ERP startup, raises $22M Series A
Meta restructures AI unit under 'Superintelligence Labs'
items.summary:
- Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg restructures the company's AI initiatives into a new group called **Meta Superintelligence Labs**, focusing on building AI “superintelligence.”
- Alexandr Wang, ex-CEO of Scale AI, is appointed chief AI officer; Nat Friedman, former GitHub CEO, heads AI products and applied research.
- The company invests heavily in AI, including a $14.3 billion investment in Scale AI, and recruits top AI talent from competitors like DeepMind and Anthropic.

items.title: Privacy-focused app maker Proton sues Apple over anticompetitive practices
items.summary: - Proton, maker of privacy apps like Proton Mail and Proton Drive, sued Apple alleging a monopoly on smartphone app distribution and payment processing with harmful *anticompetitive policies*.  - The lawsuit criticizes Apple’s high App Store fees, restrictions on direct customer communication, and limits on app functionality, claiming they harm developers and users alike.  - Proton highlights how Apple's control enables censorship in authoritarian regimes, affecting app availability and freedom of speech globally.

items.title: Privacy-Focused Proton Sues Apple Over App Store Practices
items.summary:
- *Proton*, maker of privacy-focused apps, has sued Apple alleging its App Store monopoly enforces *anticompetitive practices* and high fees akin to tariffs.
- The lawsuit challenges Apple's control over app payment processing, distribution, and policies limiting direct customer communication and app capabilities.
- Proton highlights *free speech concerns*, citing Apple’s app removals in authoritarian countries and calls for legal changes to prevent monopoly abuses.

items.title: Congress may block AI laws for 5 years: implications
items.summary:
- A **federal proposal** could ban states from regulating AI for five years, impacting *state laws* like California’s transparency law.
- Proponents argue it’s necessary to prevent a *regulatory patchwork*, while critics warn it blocks *consumer protections* and oversight.
- The Senate is voting amid **debate** over the provision’s effects, with significant opposition from both parties; *public concern* favors more regulation.

items.title: A comprehensive list of 2025 tech layoffs
Google embraces AI in the classroom with new Gemini tools for educators, chatbots for students, and more
items.summary:
- Google announced over 30 AI-powered tools at the ISTE edtech conference, including the Gemini AI suite for educators, aimed at enhancing personalized and engaging learning experiences alongside human teaching.  
- Features include AI-assisted lesson planning, interactive study guides via Notebook LM, custom AI tutors called "Gems," and expanded access to Google Vids for video creation by teachers and students.  
- Additional updates help manage student progress analytics, data security, and classroom control tools like Class Tools that enable teachers to share curated content and focus student attention on specific tasks.

items.title: Mexican drug cartel hacker spied on FBI official’s phone to track and kill informants, report says
Ex-Meta engineers have built an AI tool to plan every detail of your trip
Three powerhouses cover how to prepare now for your later-stage raise at TechCrunch Disrupt 2025
Tiny AI ERP startup Campfire wins many NetSuite clients, secures $35M Series A
items.summary:
- Campfire, an AI-powered accounting startup, raised $35 million in a Series A led by Accel, rapidly gaining customers who replaced NetSuite with its modern ERP solution.  
- Founded by John Glasgow leveraging his extensive finance background, Campfire automates tedious finance tasks using large language models for features like AWS bill reconciliation and faster monthly closes.  
- Despite being a small player against Oracle's billion-dollar NetSuite business, Campfire's traction with startups and a global customer approaching $250M ARR convinced Accel to invest heavily in this $56 billion ERP market.

items.title: Cursor Launches Web App to Manage AI Coding Agents
items.author: Maxwell Zeff
items.summary:
- **Cursor** launched a web app enabling users to manage AI coding agents directly from browsers, complementing its AI-powered IDE and Slack integration.
- The app allows users to assign coding tasks via natural language, monitor agent progress, and merge results, catering to a clientele including over half of the Fortune 500.
- Cursor focuses on practical AI coding agents, projecting they will handle 20% of software engineering work by 2026, emphasizing real-world usability over demo features.

items.title: Not just luck — it’s strategy: Tiffany Luck on winning over VCs
items.summary:
- Tiffany Luck, partner at NEA, shares *strategic insights* on effectively pitching to venture capitalists (*VCs*) at TechCrunch All Stage 2025.  
- The session focuses on delivering *actionable strategies* for startups to *captivate investors* and secure necessary funding through clear, impactful storytelling.  
- Luck specializes in early-stage AI, APIs, and B2B SaaS investments and emphasizes that winning over VCs requires *more than luck* — it demands preparation, clarity, and understanding what investors truly value.

items.title: Jennifer Neundorfer on how AI is reshaping the way startups are built — live at TechCrunch All Stage
Kristen Craft brings fresh fundraising strategy to the Foundation Stage at TechCrunch All Stage
Tinder to require new users in California to use facial recognition tech to verify their profiles
Google inks its first fusion power deal with Commonwealth Fusion Systems
Spotify revamps its Discover Weekly playlist after ten years
items.summary: - *Spotify* has updated its *Discover Weekly* playlist, adding genre controls that allow Premium users to tailor recommendations toward specific music styles. - The feature lets listeners influence algorithmic curation, enhancing personalization by selecting genre filters to push their music discovery. - Discover Weekly has delivered over 100 billion streams, with 77% from emerging artists, emphasizing its impact and the importance of giving users more control.

items.title: Why AI will eat McKinsey’s lunch — but not today
items.summary:
- Navin Chaddha of Mayfield predicts AI will transform industries like consulting, law, and accounting by automating repetitive tasks and offering outcome-based pricing, achieving *software-like margins* in traditionally labor-heavy fields.  
- He advises startups to target neglected, fragmented markets (small businesses) rather than competing directly with big firms like Accenture or McKinsey, emphasizing *AI teammates* that collaborate with humans rather than replace them.  
- The transition poses an *innovator’s dilemma* for large firms reluctant to shift from predictable revenue models, while AI-driven startups like Gruve are already proving high margins and customer acceptance in early pilots.

items.title: OpenAI reportedly ‘recalibrating’ compensation in response to Meta hires
Trump says he’s found a buyer for TikTok
items.summary:
- President Trump announced a group of **'very wealthy people'** are set to buy TikTok, pending approval from China’s President Xi Jinping.  
- Details about the buyers remain undisclosed, with Trump promising to reveal more in **two weeks**.  
- Trump has previously delayed enforcement actions against TikTok's owner ByteDance, suggesting a **joint venture** or acquisition by U.S. allies including Larry Ellison or Elon Musk.

items.title: With ‘F1’, Apple finally has a theatrical hit
items.author: Anthony Ha
items.summary:
- Apple has achieved its first major box office success with 'F1', which is topping theaters and set to become its highest-grossing film globally.  
- Directed by Joseph Kosinski and featuring Brad Pitt, 'F1' leverages realistic cinematography and benefits from the growing popularity of Formula One, supported by cross-promotion with Apple’s technology and retail operations.  
- Despite strong earnings, the film’s high $200 million budget raises questions about profitability, with some seeing it as an expensive advertisement for Apple TV+ content.

items.title: Authors Urge Publishers to Limit AI Use
items.summary:
- A group of authors including Lauren Groff and Lev Grossman signed an **open letter** urging book publishers to *limit AI usage*, such as only hiring *human audiobook narrators*.  
- They argue their work has been *exploited* by AI companies without compensation, calling for a pledge to never release *AI-created books* or replace human staff with AI.  
- Despite authors suing tech firms over unauthorized AI training, recent federal court rulings have favored companies like Meta and Anthropic.
